hero.subtitle: Gaia-X: Data Sovereignty for Europe
hero.title: A Federated and Secure Data Infrastructure
hero.body: Gaia-X represents the next generation of data infrastructure: an **open, transparent and secure digital ecosystem**, where data and services can be made available, collated and shared in an environment of trust. The architecture of Gaia-X is based on the principle of decentralisation.

paragraphs.title: A Minimal Viable Gaia-X on DLT
paragraphs.body: The principle of a federated data infrastructure is a perfect fit for Distributed Ledger Technology. [Ocean Protocol](https://oceanprotocol.com) offers a free open-source technology stack, leveraging DLT and open-source components to give control to the consumers, service providers and federators of an ecosystem. This Minimal Viable Gaia-X demonstrator is built with the Ocean Protocol stack to showcase how a Minimal Viable Gaia-X and Federation Services on DLT can work, today.

paragraphs.title: The Compute-to-Data paradigm
paragraphs.body: One core concept of Ocean Protocol is the **Compute-to-Data (CtD)** approach. Compute-to-Data is the functionality that solves the current trade-off between the benefits of using private data and the risks of exposing it. It allows data consumers to run compute jobs on private data while the data stays on-premise with the data provider.
